Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: RedHobo
Reviews.Content: The two kids (11 and 17) and I stayed in a single room at Las Casitas in April 2012 and had a wonderful vacation. The landscaping is beautiful, the room and bathroom spacious and up-to-date, and resort staff are all gracious. The facilities (pools, Golden Door spa, water slides, beach at Palomino Island) of El Conquistador resort adjoining really made it work. Visits to the El Yunque rainforest and kayaking the bioluminescent bay nearby (really, really special) added just enough non-beach activity to keep us happy. I would recommend getting a rental car to enable getting off-resort to get to off-site restaurants and elsewhere. The only major drawback is that the food at on-site restaurants is very pricey ($16 hamburgers with soggy french fries) and barely mediocre (think Denny's quality and inexplicable substitution of romaine and tomatoes for "fresh baby greens and avocado"). I'm comfortable with the price but fail to understand why a Waldorf Astoria resort would tolerate such lousy food. Off-site restaurants (most notably El Estacion - less than 1/2 mile from resort entrance) are much higher quality and offer a lot of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: Today We arrived, definitely is a lovely hotel And has its private beach. Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jerseybum1
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. I spent 4 days in a 2br casita with my girlfriend in march '11. We also had a couple friends fly down for 2 nights and we had an amazing time. The casita was great, very new kitchen and breathtaking view from the front porch. Bathrooms slightly dated but otherwise perfect. There's a great Infiniti pool by the casitas or jump on the golf cart shuttles and head over to conquistadors big pool or down to the boat that delivers you to their beautiful private island. If you want to save a FEW bucks take advantage of the kitchen. We (I) did breakfast there every morning and also did most of our own store bought beverages. The golf course was extremely nice as well and the butler service at the casitas is excellent, especially if your looking for that local spirit you can't find in the stores or just want some recommendations on what to do or how to get there. Free bottled water and free parking was definitely a nice bonus. I can't wait to get back again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Las Casitas Village - Awesome !!”
Reviews.Author: mohanvp1
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort during Mid-April 2012 and I'm glad we did. 4 of us traveled. Two kids (9 and 6) Kids loved the fantastic pools. Not only at the Las Casitas property but also the neighboring El Conquistador resort (same resort family) Palomino island was also great. I swam to the Palominito islet from Palomino. Awesome clear blue waters. Palomino island is owned by the Resort. Resort itself is huge. Be prepared to walk around. However for us it wasn't a problem since we were looking for a bit of a cardio anyway :-) There is however a shuttle service between the Casitas and the Conquistador. Golf courses were beautiful to look at (we don't play golf) We didn't care that there wasn't a beach at the property itself. Palomino island took care of that. There cleaned the room twice a day. Great !! Well serviced. Downsides: (minor ones) Shower in room had no power. Since we visited during spring break, the resort was quite busy and didn't receive great service at the Blossoms restaurant. Weren't happy about that. However decided to let go in the larger scheme of things. Would definitely visit this resort again. The kids loved the pools as well as the hot tubs. The Casitas pool over looks the Caribbean sea. The view was simply out if this world. Also one of the hot tubs over looks the sea. Again, very nice and relaxing !

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: PR2012isEnchanting
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at Las Casitas-we spent spring break there last year as well. We were absolutely thrilled with our experience again this year! Our one bedroom Casita overlooked the ocean. The bedroom overlooked a beautiful courtyard and pool. The Casita had space for our two children to stay on air mattresses in the living room. The room was spotless and cleaned to perfection each day. The Manor House staff is so warm and welcoming! Lillian (Lilly), Eddie, Max (Las Casitas Manager), Sonia (food and beverage) were especially gracious and wonderful!! They welcomed us back as if we are family and everyone who assisted us was professional and courteous, happy to offer suggestions. The pools at Las Casitas are beautiful, and were never crowded. The infinity pool is the most popular, but we had no difficulty finding seats and loved the view. Our stay was during spring break/Easter, and we never found the property crowded. We loved Palomino Island, and made sure we brought our water shoes as the sandy areas can become rocky with coral. We rented Kayaks, snorkeled and were impressed that even during spring break the island did not seem too overpopulated. One thing we tried was spending mornings at a Las Casitas pool then heading to Palomino for the afternoon. It seems to significantly empty out around 2pm, and we had a great time! The lunch restaurant at Las Casitas near the infinity pool was exceptionally nice with very good sandwiches. The grounds are beautiful and we often walked from Las Casitas to the main hotel. We tried restaurants off the property for dinner. We very much love La Estacion! Metropol was also quite good. Bohio was an authentic experience and lots of fun with a warm welcome from the ownerâ€™s family members. We highly recommend Mini Boat Adventures! The electric boat bio bay tour is also great. Las Casitas is the perfect destination for an amazing family vacation! Canâ€™t wait to return again for a third stay!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Around for Kid's Â§pring Break”
Reviews.Author: FrankConsumer
Reviews.Content: After considering a few other options we decided last minute to head back to PR in part because it is an easy direct flight from NYC with 8 and 11 year olds in tow. Came close to trying La Costa near San Diego but the effort to get there did not add up for a 4 day / 5 night stay. This time we opted not rent a car and instead used the hotel bus which was fine as we only went off the Waldorf property 1 night via taxi for dinner at El Passione (our favorite). Because we booked late we were at the furthest end of Las Casitas from the hotel which of course means a longer wait for transport to get to the hotel. Even though the weather was not perfect, we had some great afternoons at the small but adequate waterpark and one afternoon where we invited friends over to hotel-owned Palamino (sp?) Island where our daughter took her ritual horseback ride (don't expect a true aquestrian experience) and our son discovered the oversized chess set which facilitated meeting other kids. Also It is not a cheap holiday -budget 5K for a family of 4 for 5 nights including flights. But if you want a break from winter along with activities for kids, it is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Helen K
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 bedroom ocean view villa. We stayed for a week and the weather was beautiful. Pros: 1.Housekeeping was really great !!! We never had to call the front desk for anything. 2.They even stocked the refrigerator with free bottled water. 3. The service around the pool area was very nice and friendly. 4.It was also very convenient to have a white card that allowed you to charge everything to the room. 5. There was a van that took us from the villa to the main hotel any time of the day which was very convenient. The drivers were very nice and they didn't take more than 5 minutes to pick us up. Cons: 1. There should have been more parasols (umbrellas) by the pool. 2. The water park wasn't much of a water park. (make sure to go after 1pm for half price entrance fee) 3. The funicular (cablecar like shuttle) was required for access to Palomino as well as the water park. They really need to create another means of transport since the funicular took awhile. 4. It is such a big place and it did take time to get from one place to another. 5. At check out, there was a resort fee of about $95 per day. This was a surprise. It really should be reflected in the room rate when booking instead of after.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Apollo A
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Las Casitas. The accommodations were very nice. The views are spectacular. We reserved a 1 bedroom 'garden' view, but our condo had a great view of the ocean and the rainforest. We had 4 in our group(2 adults, 2 teens) and the room was more than comfortable enough for all. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. There was supposed to be 'butler' service, but we never met our butler(usually introduced at check in, but we just went straight to our condo and we missed him), but we really didn't need him. Try to request a room on the NORTH side of the complex or close to the infinity pool, the walk to the hotel is very easy if you are on the north side. We never had to use a golf cart or van to get to the hotel. The private island is very nice but took a while to get there via boat ferry. But we prefer unsalted waters anyway and spent most of our lounge time in the infinity pool. If you want to do any water sports on the private island(jetski, kayak, etc), reserve early, it books up fast. If there is any negative to this resort, it would be the high prices at the restaurants. The food and service at all restaurants were very good, but pricey. We ate at Drakes, Stingrays, Cafe Bella Visa and Ballyhoo. Other nights we ate off the resort in San Juan, Fajardo, or Luqillio. Since we had a kitchen we bought our own breakfast foods and ate in our condo(on the balcony). The location was perfect for us as most of the excursions we wanted to do were in the NE side of the island. It is about 60+ minutes to Old San Juan, 30 minutes to El Yunque, 10 to 15 minutes to marinas that offer snorkeling or bio bay tours. Las Casitas offers free parking vs 10-15/day at the hotel. They also offer free wifi, which I believe is also additional cost at the hotel. With Las Casitas, you get access to all the pools on the entire resort, Hotel guests are not allowed in the Las Casitas pools. Las Casitas obviously higher priced than the hotel rooms, but extra $ is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property, great people and tons of things to do”
Reviews.Author: MarcBoy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeklong visit in a 3 bedroom oceanview Casita. Las Casitas Villages is the Villa/Condo section of El Conquistador Resort. These units include a full kitchen, living room and a large patio/balcony. We have stayed in several Carribean units of these type (Harborside Atlantis, Westin St. John) and this unit had by far the largest rooms. Each of the three bathrooms had an enormous bathtub. The master bath even had a bidet! THE UNITS HAD INCREDIBLE SOUNDPROOFING, the least outside noise I've ever had in a resort stay. The unit (thank you Yadisse) and ground were spotless and we regularly saw staff maintaining the expansive property. One thing missing from the unit was a washer/dryer relatively common in such units. Instead, they offer a "wash and fold" service where you can fill a laundry bag full of clothes and they'll turn it around in a day for $25. Onsite self-laundry would be a plus. We highly recommend this resort for families travelling with children. We'd also recommned renting a car (<1 hr drive from airport) which isn't much more expensive than paying for airport transfers and gives you the flexibility to shop for groceries (Ralphs is <15 minutes away right off Route 3, and is comparable to a large grocery store in the upper 48) and go on excursions. We very much enjoyed RAINFOREST ZIPLINE, EL YUNQUE RAINFOREST, LOQUILLO KIOSKS, and ERIN GO BRAGH SNORKEL CHARTER ere able to get "in and out" in a way not possible if you did a bigger, more organized tour. Our advice is to get groceries for breakfast and lunch and splurge for dinners on-site. We did go to the Loquillo Kiosks one night and enjoyed Jefe Burger (order your dinner here then browse other kiosks while you wait) and a great Cheesesteak at Richys. The Casitas are perched on a cliff with a wonderful view. There are three pools reserved for Casitas guests that were never full, including a beatiful infinity edge pool overlooking the ocean. Just a five minute walk (albeit with lots of uphill steps) gets you to the El Conquistador main hotel area which includes another 2 large pools and most of the available restaurants. Another five minutes get you to the funicular which takes you down to the Marina where you can catch the ferry to Palomino Island (great Parasailing, thanks Captain Joy and a solid horseback ride are available). There is solid snorkelling just yards off the beach and several kid friendly activities like mini golf, basketball and soccer. Alternatively, you can go to the small waterpark which features 3 great slides perfect for 6-14 year olds. After 1:30, it is about half price and at 4 pm, it drops to just $5. The Casitas also offers shuttle service to the main hotel that was variably reliable. Several times, we called and a ride was waiting within minutes of our call but on more than one occasion, we waited much longer. We were pleased with the onsite dining, rating Stingray (seafood) our favorite. Informal dining at Ballyhoo and Cafe Bella Vista (great non-alcoholic drinks!) were both excellent. We had Hibatchi/Tappanyaki at Blossoms and it was solid. Our only disappointing dinner was at Cafe Caribe which had an overdose of fried food. The snack bar at Coqui Waterpark had great snacks, including fairly priced root beer floats. We were impressed with the friendliness of the staff including Yolanda, Lilly and Wanda. While we didn't have too many favors to ask, there was always an abundance of great butlers available to offer tour advice or help with luggage including Casey, RIcardo, Eggy and Carlos.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveler2012
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that I can't remember a better family vacation. The staff is amazing. Villa's spotless. Thank you Steve (the butler) for as others have said-"Going above and beyond". Our children loved him. Ana, you were quick to respond to a question/request prior to our arrival. Would return with our family of 5 in a minute and hope to soon. Children ages:7,8, and 12.

Reviews.Title: “Las Casitas: Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Steve G
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all of the staff, especially Steve (our butler)! We had a great time. Views are stunning, pools great, good food, beach was wonderful. All around, a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom987
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Las Casitas Village (February 2012.) Our one bedroom villa was perfect for our family of three. Compliments to our butler, Ricardo Rodriguez, who was very accommodating and attentive to any of our requests. We enjoyed our visits to Palomino Island, Old San Juan, and El Yunque Rainforest. Our room, 5301, had a nice ocean view and was near the Infinity Pool, which was great. We ate at all of the hotel restaurants. We found the food to be very good but expensive, probably to be expected at a resort of this caliber. A great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, have realistic expectations”
Reviews.Author: ElizCJ
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom casita with a fabulous view of both the ocean, the offshore islands, and the mountains with the rainforest. The room was clean, the kitchen was great (order groceries in advance) for occasional breakfast, snacks and cocktails. The Casitas portion of the resort is quiet, with lovely pools and a small bar/lunch spot as well as a nice (but not opulent) breakfast buffet. the rainforest tour, bioluminescent bay kayaking and day trip to San Juan were all great, we missed out on snorkeling due to weather. The adjacent El Conquistador offers the large, convention hotel experience of big restaurants, pool bar with music and adults wandering around in the pool with beer cans. The restaurant quality was inconsistent and prices are high. Sugary rum drinks abound! But, you can spend most of your time on the Casitas side and only dip into the big hotel experience when necessary. Tennis is free, the golf course looked like fun but we did not play. Iguanas are everywhere and our children kept track of the number of smaller lizards they saw (very cute lizards). Offsite dining is available for the mildly adventurous- we had a fabulous, fun and authentically local meal two minutes outside of the hotel gate. We did rent out own car for the week, as airport transfers and what the hotel would charge for a day trip into old San Juan for our family of five exceeded the weekly cost of the rental. We will probably return, and hope to see more of the island as well as the outlying islands of Culebra and Viecques on our next trip. As long as you don't have expectations of an ultra-luxury spot, and especially if you are looking for a good home base for a little independent exploration of the island Las Casitas made our family very happy for our six night stay.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Long Beach, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Jeff M
Reviews.Content: First we gave it 4 out of 5 stars. The place is awesome for kids. Great weather, great staff Two complaints: 1) there was a great deal of confusion pre arrival regarding our reservations, and since a) most people on the reservation lines spoke poor english and b) one could not look up their reservation details online, it made for a lot of unease before the trip. 2) the lunch & dinner choices were disappointing, and the food quality was inconsistent. if you did not go to one of the top restaurants (and we have little kids so that was not an option) you really felt like you were getting nothing for your dollar. This was a complaint we heard from many other guests when we were there as well

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort for Families”
Reviews.Author: worldly74
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed at Las Casitas this time. A few years back we stayed at El Conquistador which is on the same property. This was a fabulous vacation! ROOMS : We had a one bedroom suite. The entire Las Casitas complex is impressive with immaculate landscaping. It has the feel of an Italian Village. The room had an incredible view overlooking the Caribbean Sea. BY FAR the best view of any hotel we have ever stayed at. The rooms were a bit dated but kitchen had modern appliances and everything was clean. 5 STARS SERVICE : Attentive. The staff was friendly and always had a smile. 5 STARS FOOD : Food was hit or miss. The breakfast buffet which was included in our package was very good with a good selection. The Chinese restaurant was average to below average. Overall, the restaurants on the property were expensive considering that food was overall average to above average. There are several local restaurants in Fajardo that are more reasonably priced with better food. 2 1/2 STARS BEACH/POOL : Amazing. The island owned by the resort, which is a 10 minute ferry ride away, was beautiful. Lots of activities on the island to do. Kids loved the beach and we took an amazing kayak ride to a smaller "deserted island" close to the island. Pools were clean and not overcrowded. The infinity pool at the Las Casitas was amazing. 5 STARS LOCATION : While about an hour away from San Juan which is still a reasonable drive, the resort is in an ideal location to explore Puerto Rico. The tropical rainforest, bioluminesence bay and boats to Vieques are all in close proximity. 4 1/2 STARS Overall, fantastic resort. Would highly recommend it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: edhryb
Reviews.Content: Second time to the El Conquistador, first to Las Casitas and we were very happy with the switch. Villa was spacious, spotless and serene. Wonderful staff. Fridge offered the opportunity to stock up with breakfast supplies, snacks and some drinks to keep costs down somewhat. Even during Presidents' week, pools in village offered plenty of chairs, towels and quiet. Palamino Island and water park definitely worth a couple of visits, especially if you have kids 5-13. Island offers water sports, swimming in calm waters, basketball hoop, soccer net and lunch and drinks. Water park will keep the kids occupied for hours. Main pool is nice, but it gets a bit nasty by late afternoon. It could use a mid-day cleaning. Lunch and breakfast are fine. For dinner, try the dorado or lobster tail at Stingray at the marina. Chicken or lobster tail at the Strip House (steaks only average) and hit Blossoms for the sushi and Japanese hibachi. Brick oven pizza option great for a more casual meal. Be sure to try the Ballyhoo drink at the Ballyhoo bar in the marina. Golf course is great, even for a quick 9 holes. Also check out the inshore fishing with Capt. Marcos, at a marina 5 minutes from the resort. Be sure to cook up your catch at the marina's grill. Wife seemed to enjoy the spa as well. If you're looking for more quiet and privacy, stay at the south side of the village, farther from main resort. Stay north if you plan to hit island and water park a couple of times. Be prepared to do a bit of walking, taking a ferry to island, and a hillside elevator/tram down to marina and water park. if this seems like a big inconvenience for you, try somewhere else. If not, enjoy all the beautiful scenery along the way.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT FAMILY VACATION!”
Reviews.Author: lorifabs
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful vacation at the Las Casitas Village! This was our 2nd trip to this resort and we will definitely return again. Our family of 5 (children aged 10, 9, 5) enjoyed the beautiful spacious 2 bedroom oceanview villa. The service was excellent and all the employees were extremely friendly and helpful! We would like to extend our special thanks to our butler, Steve Ortiz for going above and beyond during our stay. He even checked during his nonworking hours to ensure everything was going well! It is definitely an excellent choice for families!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: bigtime23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Las Casitas in February 2012. Initially disappointed that 2 queen beds were turned into 1 king and sofa bed (that got pretty old as the week went on),. Upside was that we got an ocean view room instead of "garden view" room initially reserved. Very well maintained place, helpful staff, pools were great. Good location for anything you want in Fajardo (fishing, bio bay tour). Reviews I had read had me prepared for ridiculous prices for restaurants (we only at at 1 and went in surrounding areas for others) but the prices struck me as normal hotel restaurant pricing. Water park is good for younger kid - my 13 year old was looking for more excitement after about 45 minutes. Palomino island is fun with various activities (jet ski, boats) but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Fajardo property”
Reviews.Author: Dave41707
Reviews.Content: The Las Casitas village suites in the El Conquistador are great. Very good service, very accessible, with constant shuttle bus service to the main hotel. The beach views are stunning. The hotel is very clean - we haven't seen a bug in 4 nights. The hotel's restaurants and services are all very good; the food is not the top highlight, though fine. If you play golf, the course is gorgeous. Perhaps the top features are the hotel's great pools, its own private island with nice beach area (not too crowded), and a fun water park with water slides (this costs additional money to visit, but it's not too crowded and is right on the property. Definitely an outstanding place for a top luxury resort vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Find”
Reviews.Author: Patti M
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Las Casitas for 4 nights in a 3 bedroom Ocean View villa with our family of 5 - 2 parents and children aged 24, 22 and almost 17. The villas was absolutely lovely and the service at the resort top notch and honestly friendly. Our only negative was how much time it took to get to the beach as you are dependent on different forms of transportation to do so: shuttle bus, cable car, ferry). But even with that, we'd go back in a second and had a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “They don't get any better than this.”
Reviews.Author: 124C41NewEngland
Reviews.Content: Las Casitas Village is a lovely hotel seperated from El Conquitaror by the Golden Door Spa. You have access to all the larger resorts features (golf, water park, private island) yet you are in a seperate world of flower lined streets, fountains and pools. The entire complext is amazing and many never leave. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “best views”
Reviews.Author: Robanran
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with fantastic views. Most of the staff are friendly and helpful (except for the 2 gentlemen working at the infinity pool) no personality and if you asked for a drink or lunch they acted like you were bothering them...that being said the hotel was great and we can't wait to return Our butler Joey P. made our stay even better. Thanks Joey

Reviews.Title: “Hit by the Hurricane”
Reviews.Author: DrSoto
Reviews.Content: The facility was beautiful especially the golf course and the grounds. We had our balcony looking out of a cliff. It was great until the storm hit and then there wasn't much done by the staff when the chaos broke out. We had an 18 month old and we couldn't have sub par accommodations. We had to hire an outside service to come in get us with a big four wheel drive van and take us to the Ritz near the airport. I will say had the storm not happened then we would have had a wonderful stay. The butler service was a little slow and sometimes wouldn't come through until you called again. The first 4 out of our ten day trip was great. I just think the hotel should have better procedures in place for disaster. Of course, the locals saw this as normal and didn't think it was a big deal. If you want something on a beach then tis place is not for you. We had to take a catamaran to their private island for the beach and some other activities and it was great. I also would be aware when hurricane season is, because i wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TakeMeHome2
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional resort and the Las Casitas village is the perfect place to stay for those who like to live it up during the day but desire a quiet and tranquil evening. Be warned - the room rates, restaurants, groceries, activities, parking, and everything else at the resort are crazy expensive. If you prepare yourself before making the trip and accept the fact that you will be paying nearly double for everything you do, you will have a wonderfully great time. We stayed for 6 nights and spent 10k for everything - air, hotel, car rental, meals, entertainment, etc. Most of the other reviews will give you a good idea of what the resort is like. If you're like me, the deciding factor on staying at Las Casitas is all about money. Here are a few tips on saving some money that may help. Our group of 5 included 2 adults and 3 teenagers. How to save some money - We booked our room through the Hilton reservation 800 number. They were extremely helpful in getting us the best rate possible and made us aware of current programs. They hooked us up with the "Puerto Rico Getaway" program that takes a substantial percent off of your room, provides free drink certificates, 20% off Spa services, $25 matching gift card for the casino, and more. Having a full kitchen allowed us to shop at the local grocery store to save money on meals. The hotel offers a shopping service that allows you to order your groceries through the hotel for a $25 initial fee, plus $5 for each additional order. I do not recommend using this service. The groceries that the hotel provides are at the hotel prices not the local grocery store price. Besides, shopping with the locals was an adventure all its own. We tried nearly all of the restaurants at the resort. All of the high end places are over rated and overpriced. None of them compared to big city steak, seafood, Italian, or Chinese places we've been to. If you eat at the resort try the less formal outdoor places and order off the childrenâ€™s menu. We found the childrenâ€™s portions are nearly as big as the normal portions with no difference in food quality. Also, there are plenty of places to eat within a 10 minute drive. All of your major fast food chains are close by with several really nice local places as well. Bottom line - you will save money on every meal you eat outside of the resort. Unlike previous visits, we booked all of our activities on our own and did not use the hotel recommended vendors. This saved us a substantial amount of money and I believe the vendors we used (via trip advisor) provided better service. You do not need a tour guide for the rainforest. There are only 3 or 4 hiking trails and all are clearly marked. It has an educational center with a $4 entrance fee. This includes a very informative movie in a small theater. If you are celebrating an anniversary, birthday or any other special occasion the hotel will provide a $40 bottle of champaign in your room on arrival. Nice of them! If you ask, they will pack your fridge with a case of their bottled water (Las Casitas brand!) free of charge. This saved us tons of money as a bottle of water at many places is about $3. There is no difference in quality. Las Casitas has free Wi Fi throughout the village and in the rooms. Although they offer a "premium" Wi Fi service we found the free service to be fast and reliable. This was great and allowed us to instantly look up places to eat or things to do without having to go to the business center. Snorkeling gear rental at the resort is about $25 per day. I bought 5 full sets (mask, fins, and snorkel) on the internet for $20 each and packed them in our suit cases. I ended up selling all 5 sets to a family on the beach for $50. Long story short, we used high quality gear for the entire week and it cost me less than it would if I rented theirs for a single day. Pack your own water shoes, sun screen, hats, sun glasses, bug spray, and under water cameras. You will need ALL of them and they are all VERY overpriced. Hope this helps. What an amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views...seemed like a European Village”
Reviews.Author: gene
Reviews.Content: After much consideration we chose Las Casitas for 3 nights after spending 4 nights in OSJ. For us this was the perfect combination..lots of exploring in OSJ...visiting El Yunque en route to Faradjo and then Las Casitas. Welcome was pleasant and efficient, villa ready in Casitas 2 section which we liked...even a bit more quiet than Casitas 1 and extraordinary views. Request some combination with a top floor for maximum views...but really they are all nice. Villa was a one bedroom oceanview and really comfortable and well equipped. We took a package with breakfast and could go to either Casitas Cafe (very close) or over to the main resort. We did both, clearly the main resort has more selection but both were nice. More peaceful at Las Casitas. Pools were nice; however we did go during a very busy holiday time including Three Kings weekend and so pools were often taken over by kids with little parental supervision. Its a family resort so that is to be expected. If you can avoid known school holidays I'm sure it would be much quieter. We managed to find pool time but had to jockey a bit. Service throughout both Las Casitas and El Con was excellent and staff very pleasant. Was everything always perfect ?...did you have to ask for expected service?..yes sometimes, but overall it was excellent and frankly far superior to what I was expecting. Funiculars, ferry to island etc. all were working and we never waited for anything. Palamino Island is extraordinary and you feel as if you are in the South Seas...really...easy to find your own spot. The restaurant over there was awful with high prices. It needs a serious upgrade. Swimming is not great...you need shoes with the coral and more importantly unless you are adept at these kinds of waters maybe stay out. We saw a man being carried on a stretcher after getting tangled up in coral and being rescued by a fellow tourist. There are no lifeguards. We loved Palamino. Only ate at Stingray and it was very busy but reservation honored and service good. Food good as well. One thing it is important to note about El Con is that it is orientated towards large groups and I don't mean family reunions. I mean incentive groups, conventions etc. and in the thousands they take the place over. I would not have enjoyed a stay at El Con. Many of the incentive groups know each other so restaurants , pools and bars can be literally taken over by them. It is very very loud and party atmosphere. They do really seem to know how to manage these groups and service did not suffer. Probably an excellent choice for such groups. This might be great for some individual travelers, but know what you are getting. Las Casitas is quiet...mostly couples or families. What is nice is you can go over a take advantage of all the facilities, restaurants etc and then return to a more tranquil environment when you want. We found that combination perfect. I would recommend booking some restaurants off site including Estacion and Passion por el Fogon. These were very good and more interesting than hotel restaurants. They are close by but require a car or taxi. As for getting around you can request a golf cart to go to the main lobby of El Con and they are available quickly. The grounds and vistas are a photographer's dream and I have included some photos taken. I visited the Golden Door spa for a massage with Claire as recommended by another TA reviewer. This was a good recommendation and I highly recommend Claire at the spa. I booked the appointment by phone in advance of arrival with Grace who was very helpful. With more time I would have gone back for sure. The location of Las Casitas is a great jumping off point for so many activities including the bio bay, El Yunque etc. I would think an active family could stay busy here for a week. I would recommend checking into booking such things as transportation and tours/activities on your own as hotel prices seems excessive...not just a bit more but way too much. Do compare. Weather was not perfect but enough sun to keep us happy and watching the rainbows from the terrace was an added bonus. I highly recommend Las Casitas. I was concerned about some reviews being negative; however I saw no evidence of lack of service and Max the general manager is totally available if you have an issue as well as the staff in the "Manor House" at Las Casitas. We would seriously consider returning to this property and I don't often say that.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise X10”
Reviews.Author: giants65
Reviews.Content: I thought St.John had some beautiful views!!! We stayed in a 1 bedroom Ocean Suite cottage and it was amazing. The cottages are very private, quiet and with the best views within the Waldorf. You have to take a shuttle to the main hotel but motor coaches and golf carts are always buzzing around. The kids loved the golf carts as we zoomed thru the golf course. Inside the Villa is nice. I did get some whiffs of mustiness as I read in other reviews but I have to say the maid services were outstanding. I would also maybe go with a 2 bedroom as the one bathroom became an issue at times with twin 12 yr old girls. The balcony is awesome with beautiful trade winds constantly blowing. Everyone is very friendly here and throughout PR. Not a sad or rude face to be found anywhere. I would come back here in a heartbeat. I did not get a chance to golf but the course looks incredible. Our list of activities included: Old San Juan - rent a car and park at the fort for 2:00 bucks an hour. You can walk the streets from here as well. Have lunch at Cafe De Puerto Rico. Unreal. Rain Forrest - rent a car as well. Easy drive and tour at your leisure. Check out El Mino Falls and go under the waterfall. Wear dryfit material and a bathing suit + watershoes. Mini-Boat Tours - Very cool. Book thru Kayaking Puerto Rico. Bioluminesent Bay - Very cool. Use Pure Adventure. Ziplinig/Rappeling - The best part of the trip. Try the San Salvador excursion from EcoQuest Tours. AMAZING!!! They will pick you up at the Las Americas Mall. Rappel down a 90 ft waterfall. Unreal!! Cocqui Water Park - Waste of money!!! Palomino Island - Cool - restaurant there is a zoo. Driving - be careful on the highways. Crazy drivers. NYC on steroids. We we side-swiped on route 3. Other than that the El Con is very nice, Casino is so-so. Drinks so-so. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, awesome views, nice private island beach”
Reviews.Author: Ernesto R
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, Palomino Island alone makes it worth it, infinity pool for Casita guests only is nice. Lots of places to eat, some expensive but some reasonable. They do seem to try to get the last penny out of you though. Overall great... Only complaints: there was a hair in our tub at check in, made me wonder about cleanliness, and the last ferry to Palomino is at 3pm making it impossible to go the day of check in, so for a one night stay plan on having to go after check out at 11am the next morning. I'd say this hotel is better enjoyed staying a minimum of two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot and nice to have peace and quiet but also enjoy all the resort amentities”
Reviews.Author: gooseontheroad
Reviews.Content: We all really enjoyed our stay at these beautiful casitas on the cliff! So glad we made the choice to stay in the casitas and not the main resort. It afforded us space to relax, a kitchen so we had breakfast, snacks and drinks at our disposal and a gorgeous view from our balcony on which to enjoy them. Since our children are at very different ages and stages, this was a great choice for us. We are a little passed the point of staying at the pool for the entire day as a way to make everyone happy, so the variety of activities and locations that the main resort offered kept everyone happy and busy. We all loved the infinity pool - it to a beautiful spot and the kids loved all the transportation options from the golf carts, to the tram to the boat out to Palomino Island. The one thing that I do think could be improved upon are the food options, and if we were to go back, I would probably look into getting some recommendations to eat outside the resort for some of our meals. We did pay for an Aero bed which is far more comfortable for our teenager, than sleeping on a pull out couch! Just good to know if you are traveling with kids. If you are going during a school break, make sure that you have reservations for dinner as otherwise you are going to find yourself waiting and with kids that can spoil a nice night. Also, bring your wallet, the food is pricey. All that having been said, our children both said it was one of the best places that they had ever been on vacation and that they would love to return. P.S - they loved trip to the rain forest also

Reviews.Title: “Las Casitas Dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: We checked in to Las Casitas and expected to be taken to one of those beautiful rooms shown in ad. Instead, they attempted to place us in an older supposidly renovated room. It was dark and musty smelling with SAG carpeting! We spent close to $5K on this trip and we DID NOT expect to be trashed like that. Yes, they did provide another room but it took close 3-4 hrs. We sat in that dank dirthole until then. A major part of the allure was destroyed because we were not initially ushered into the beautiful room. The Manager, Ronald Maidens, adeeply apologized and said we'd get a free night with another visit. He NEVER repsonded to my email inquiry later on. never recve a gift certificate or anything. Make sure you are NOT getting one of those filthy rooms. John, Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: Josh B
Reviews.Content: Nice section a bit more removed from the large conquistador resort area nice rooms, good pool, solid food, take a trip out to palomino island for some good beach time, no real complaints from me

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, peaceful resort”
Reviews.Author: nyctravel1211
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent our babymoon at Las Casitas in a one bedroom ocean suite. Everything was really wonderful. The property was pretty empty as it was an off week to go, so it was very quiet and relaxing. The infinity pool is great. We went over to El Con for the breakfast (which is great and has a nice selection of fresh fruits, etc) and to take the ferry to the island. It wasnâ€™t bad getting over to El Con and we waited max 5 min for someone to take us over in the golf cart. I think it would probably take longer if the resort was full. The private island is beautiful, but food at the restaurant there is not great. It can be a little inconvenient getting to the island, ferries were supposed to run every half an hour, but were running every hour instead so we had to wait 40 min for the boat. It would have been good if they posted the times in the lobby or by Las Brisas restaurant. We ate at the Italian restaurant at El Con one night and that was good. We went to La Estacion right outside the property and it was a good place for some local food. I recommend renting a car and going to Old San Juan one day. Itâ€™s only an hour drive and worth the trip! All in all, we will be back to Las Casitas!

Reviews.Title: “Las Casitas a Find!”
Reviews.Author: kayak41952
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful week at the villas! Service was exceptional. I highly recommend the spa. The Villas were the best for a romantic getaway-I would not stay in the huge, slightly overwhelming hotel portion of the property. This is ideally suited for teenagers, however, who will love it. Loved every second of the quieter Villas and miss the infinity pool!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: luckygirl13
Reviews.Content: Las Casitas property is beautiful, the service was wonderful, especially Carlos, our butler. It was quiet despite full occupancy, very clean and the Infinity pool is out of this world. We dined at the Stingray, Strip House and Blossoms all were very good with excellent service. Pricey but that's what's to be expected at this type of resort. Richard gave my husband one of the best massages he's every had. We had a very relaxing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: William L
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 days there while attending my sons wedding, everything was fantastic! 1st class all the way, the attention to every detail was great. The grounds are beautiful, everything was very clean, the pools were inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy2aprince
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with the facts the golf coarse and grounds are beautiful! As far as service Very very poor! If you pay extra to be in an exclusive part of the resort you expect better service(I am just crazy like that). Horrible staff the only people I would say were reliable has to be the same 2 guys that would give us a ride from our room to the main hotel. We never saw our butler again after he showed us to our room. Do not waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: SmilesDb8
Reviews.Content: I would recommend claire for all massages! And grace for all appointments!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Barbofky
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Las Casitas Village the week of August 6, 2011. Our children ages 23, 20, and 14 were with us for this vacation as well as my very active 81 year old mother. My husband and I had stayed there fifteen years ago and loved our vacation at that time as well. Our family stayed in a three bedroom oceanfront casita with gorgeous views. A beautiful balcony overlooking the water and mountains started out our day while we drank coffee and relaxed before breakfast. We had a wonderful breakfast buffet at the casitas restaurant each morning. You could order off the menu for anything else you wanted for a little extra. The food at the resort is expensive, but no more than any other island resort we have been to in the past. The casita was very nice with a full updated kitchen. We did have fresh fruit and water delivered everyday by the very nice staff at the resort. We found everyone to be friendly, helpful and wanting to make us happy with all our requests. All of the staff at the hotel spoke fluent English, but we also enjoyed trying out a little bit of Spanish now and then which everyone seemed to help us with at all times. We found everyone in Puerto Rico to be kind, genuine, and proud of their home. Our family loved the variety of activities available to all of us. From the beautiful private island to golf, tennis, shopping , casino, and the great salsa music at night. We did not have enough days even after a week to do all the activities available. All of our children told us they would happily return and so would my Mom! We also spent a half day in the rain forest and in old San Juan. We did eat outside the property three nights at great restaurants nearby. We went to La Estacion, Passion por el Fogon, and Lelelolai for fantastic tapas. We also really enjoyed Stingray Cafe at the marina area for dinner. The pools in the Casita area were all very clean and beautiful. We loved the infinity pool! It was great to walk out our door and be able to swim late at night as well. We found clean towels and fresh cold water with lemons each day by the pools. Overall a great family trip that we would all love to repeat as soon as possible. Thanks to all of the wonderful staff at the El Conquistador and Las Casitas Resort!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful respite for our family”
Reviews.Author: journeyhers
Reviews.Content: We wanted a vacation in which the biggest decision was "what pool should we go to?". We accomplished this at Las Casitas and El Conquistador. We had a three bedroom casita, but could have gone with 2 bedrooms, for our family (myself and husband, 2 year old daughter and nanny) Our butler and the service was very attentive to our questions and needs - we didn't know how to work the air conditioning and they quickly came over with a lesson for us. We did have a torrential rain one day and there was some leakage from the main living room window and the front door, so we just put towels around to keep it at bay. Lots of great pools - our favorites were the main pool (upper level) at the main hotel, and the infinity pool at Las Casitas. Our only "gripe" is the food-to-price value. The food was overpriced for the quality that it was. Much of it was the quality of an American chain, like Friday's or Applebees - but priced at tourist trap prices (think Times Square prices for a Friday's burger) We had a phenomenal meal at the marina level seafood restaurant, and also had some great meals off the resort - my favorite was at La Estacion just down the road from the hotel. We will definitely return - we loved the energy and ease of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Best in PR”
Reviews.Author: Jorge L
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion planned in PR for July and decided to stay at Las Casitas. GREAT decision. The service was wonderful, dispite the occupancy rate (over 90% due to the holidays). The rooms were really clean every day. The buttler service was impressive... Eddie, our buttler, was very helpful for every need we had. All in all, a great place to stay, relax and enjoy the wonders of the East side of PR. The only issue we experienced was a power black out for about 14 hrs and realizing that the property in Las Casitas has no emergency power generator for the rooms (being in PR, that is a must). Needless to say, next morning, we spoke to the hotel manager and we were properly compensated. They didn't charge us for that night ($850) plus paid for our dinner at one of the restaurants due to the fact we could not cook at home that night ($170). Very nice from them. This is definitely a place to stay. Views are the best on the island and the staff keep the common areas very clean. We will be back. This one is a go.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Ricos best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: family_man2199
Reviews.Content: I brought my family of four and had a great time. The casitas were exclusive and private with their own private dining areas they had chauffeur service on golf carts to the conquistador whenever we needed it which my kids loved, the two double bed room was tight for all of us but u never spend much time in them. And the views from the casitas of the ocean were magnificent!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: LandJ000
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The service was great and we got everything we request promptly. I loved everything about the hotel. The guestroom was outdated, but we did not care because we spent most hanging out in the pools and the Palomino Island. The housekeeping service was amazing. They came during the day to do the room and again at night to prepare the bed. They did a great job. This hotel became our favorite and we would like comeback in the near future. We had the breakfast included package and it was amazing. However, we decided to go out for dinners. There are better restaurants with cheaper and authentic puertorican food close to the hotel. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LauraParker2011
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world and this, by far, is my husband and I's favorite place. This time we decided to bring the family. We are traveling with 4 kids and our Nanny and the 3 bedroom villa's are so comfortable. The pools are beautiful, golf course is beyond amazing, food is good, and there is a Starbucks!!!!! Heaven and free internet :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: anneandkevin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for our 45th anniversary with my husband's brother and wife, also celebrating the same anniversary a few months later. Our 2 bedroom villas was clean and well kept. The view from the very large balcony was spectacular. We had a few overgrown palm trees blocking our view at first. When we asked if they could be trimmed back, it was done the following day on a Sunday, enhancing the view even further. Everytime we made a request, it was done promptly and efficiently. We were taken to the hotel via golf cart and never waited long for a pick up. The infinity pool at Las Casitas was lovely. We ate lunch at the pool restaurant and breakfast at Las Brisas at the hotel. The breakfast buffet at Las Brisas was very good. We had a car and went out to eat locally in the evening. Enjoyed La Estacion in particular. The concierge at Las Casitas was happy to assist us with those reservations. My husband and brother-in-law enjoyed the golf and my sister-in-law and I had a message at the Golden Door Spa (very good). We were glad we picked Las Casitas over the hotel because it was much quieter with quick access to the hotel. Did not think Palomino Island beach and water was nearly as nice as some of the other islands and having to take a ferry there is a bit inconvenient. The horseback riding was fun and we had a great guide.

Reviews.Title: “Great views outside, not inside.”
Reviews.Author: the1015club
Reviews.Content: This village is adjacent to El Conquistador Resort and the scenery and views are fantastic. That said, the inside of the casita left much to be desired in the way of quality. The bathroom was dated and small and just not up to a Waldorf standard that you would expect. The kitchen was more modern, but we didn't have much need of that. The rest of the spaces, livingroom and balcony were comfortable but not deluxe. The standout is the stunning location high on a cliff. The infinity pool and hot tub were breathtaking and the private island is great. But there are loads of stairs and lots of walking to reach the restaurants and the cable car to the beach access ferry. This resort is also far from the shops and historic center of Old San Juan( over an hour). But only 15 minutes from El Yunque Rainforest.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding”
Reviews.Author: flynmatt
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week at Las Casitas Village. This is part of the El Conquistador resort. I highly recommend this over the Conquistador hotel if you want peace quiet and fewer crowds. The hotel looks nice but just walk through the villas (see attached pictures) and you will know what I mean. Truly one of the most beautiful places I've ever stayed. I canâ€™t even comprehend some of the negative reviews unless you are going to be extremely picky or like someone who complained because it rained!! geeze like they control that. The rooms were just gorgeous. They did have tube TV's and big screen LCD's would be nice for watching a movie on a rainy afternoon but thatâ€™s not enough for me to knock it. Had views from both the living room balcony (see picture) as well and the bedroom balcony. The service was the best, both concierge and especially the cleaning staff. The grounds are impeccable maintained. Three pools just for the villas one being an amazing infinity pool with a view to die for. Ended up just hanging there and soaking it all in. I would suggest getting a car to be able to explore more easily but my package included airport transfers so I didnâ€™t bother. There is a rental car agency on-site so itâ€™s easy to rent when needed. You have great cooking facilities (although providing BBQ's somewhere would be great) so plan on doing some shopping to get things as the small convenience store is just that, small, and quite expensive. As with any place there are some negatives: 1) Restaurants at the Conquistador are very expensive and the food was just okay. I was amazed when I brought a special bottle of wine to the steakhouse and they wanted a $40 corkage charge. Just absurd and it cost them money because we ate little and saved our wine and special meal for a different night. 2) No beach on the property. You need to take their ferry to their private island to get on a beach. Nothing wrong with that but would be nice to be able to just walk to a beach. Thatâ€™s it. Canâ€™t think of anything else that could be considered other then outstanding at this wonderful place to stay. I will qualify this all with our intention to kick back and relax for a week. Didnâ€™t look for nightlife, fine dining, organized tours or kids activities. So for us it was an amazing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Epic Disaster”
Reviews.Author: eamead
Reviews.Content: We chose Las Casitas because (a) we wanted a villa with separate bedrooms (grown children) and a gathering place and (b) it was a Waldorf Astoria and we expected a great experience. Wrong. It rained the entire week, save one afternoon. The hotel didn't offer any umbrellas or rain gear and we couldn't find any in the various on-site stores. The hotel offered no indoor amenities except for a small casino, two tiny, poorly maintained fitness rooms and the spa. The spa was outrageously expensive and the services were mediocre. My son played golf (in the wind and rain) and the course is very challenging. Even though we were virtually the only guests in the South Casita, we were put in a lower level room with limited view of the ocean. The furniture was very dated, cheap and infested with ants, the kitchen was poorly equipped, the A/C (dual-zoned) didn't work well on one side and the windows leaked badly throughout the storms. Room service was good and the concierge/bell service was excellent. Since we didn't rent a car, we ate all of our meals at El Conquistador--the food was over-priced, lousy, unimaginative hotel food. There were very few healthy alternatives and fewer "local cuisine" alternatives. The on-site "grocery" store was poorly stocked. Starbucks became my favorite hide-out/restaurant! Although the grounds were beautfiul, deferred maintenance was evident throughout the hotel and drainage was very poor. Consequently, many areas were flooded and closed. We spent the one sunny afternoon at the island--it was delightful; but all of the amenities (jet skis, snorkeling, etc) were expensive and limited availability. Since the hotel is situated on a 300 foot cliff, the island is the only beach. Even though there were several conferences going on, hotel occupancy was low and, so, the beach wasn't too crowded. I imagine that during high season, the beach would be very crowded and lines for the catamaran would be long. Phone and internet connectivity were very poor. The trip was such a disaster that we cut it short one day and left. Definitely NOT worth the price in any way, shape, or form. As a side note, the Bio Bay trip is over-rated--don't waste the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: jwolinsky
Reviews.Content: Great relaxing vacation with my wife for her birthday. The grounds are beautiful and the the private island is a great place to spend the day. Rent a car because it is the best way to get there from the airport and you will want to eat most of you dinners outside the resort. The hotel restaurants are ok, but very expensive for what you get. A car is also a great way to visit local tourist attractions, such as El Yunque. Las Casitas is much nicer than the main hotel and is well worth the added expense.

Reviews.Title: “11 days at Las Casitas Village Survival Kit”
Reviews.Author: jasonfrmde
Reviews.Content: Las Casitas is a beautiful destination approximately 1 hour from the airport. Rule #1 - RENT A CAR! Las Casitas offers no additional expense to have a car on location so take advantage of it. The sister property (El Conquistador) charges for this convenience. El Conquistador does have an Enterprise rental car location within the main hotel lobby at the front desk. Unsure of the hours or rates. Rule #2 - DON'T OVER PACK TO MITIGATE EXPENSE Las Casitas offers a full kitchen (microwave, stove, fridge, ice maker, and dish washer) with the cupboards stocked with with utensils, plates, glasses and pots/pans. Within 5 miles you have access to a Kmart, Walmart, CVS, Walgreens and a dozen other stores including fast food. There were 2 Costco locations (membership required) near the airport (SJU) which we stocked up on water, soda, alcohol, fruit/veggies and snacks. We also found a wonderful dry cleaners & laundry service within 2 miles (Laundry Express) on PR-3. They charged $9 for a sack of laundry to wash/dry/fold. Dry cleaning costs were also very reasonable. Rule #3 - Get off the resort for meals. There were great restaurants off of the resort. El Pasion and La Estacion were our favorites. La Estacion is a no frills/casual BBQ destination with great food from ribs and mofongo to wings and fish. El Pasion was a great destination too - parking is behind the restaurant and service is wonderful. We did eat on the resort at the Island's restaurant which was good... order from the kids menu - same items as adults with lower prices and same qty. Disregard the disclosure of age restrictions. The restaurant next to the casino is ok... I recommend the Chicken and Rice. The Steak house has a great car area for a drink or two. Dinner is also very good. We had their mofongo (not traditional but fantastic!) and bone in ribeye. Both were very good. Off the resort are many chains for kids (Burger King, McD's, Church's Chicken) and not many chains for adults (Sizzler, Pizza Hut and Ponderosa is all we saw). Rule #4 - Plan for Rainy Days There isn't much to do when it rains (which it has 80% of this trip) including a tornado! There is a DVD rental in Las Casita's front desk area known as the "Manor House." Not much activities to get into except for the spa and gym since the Casino opens at night unless you want to go to the pool during the rain. Rule #5 - You can visit the Rain Forest without paying fees When visiting the rain forrest you do not have to turn into the main entrance. The only advantage of paying the fee is obtaining a park map, visiting the park gift shop and their restaurant. Save the money and continue up the mountain! Due to an injury we couldn't hike into the mountain however one water fall and a couple stops are easily seen/visited by various parking lots along the park route. Rule #6 - Plan to walk the resort We received a wonderful Casita that was ocean front but on the south side of the resort. It's a long hike from here to the Funicular to get to the marina for the boat to the island. We lucked out and received a complimentary golf cart assigned to us for the entire stay without even asking. This added a much better experience to getting around for us. Rule #7 - Don't Stay at El Conquistador We encountered a Tornado when we were here. Due to power being out we were relocated to the main hotel for the night. Needless to say I visited 4 different rooms and all were less then par. Can't believe the Waldorf even allowed their brand for them. The ladies at the front desk of El Conquistador understood my concerns and shared how they need a full overhaul. Enter at your own risk but I would equate them to a 2 star at best. Rule #8 - Hilton Honors As a gold member I expected breakfast to be included. Not here. We did receive a complimentary pass to the Golden Door Spa gym which was wonderful and my girlfriend enjoyed their steam room and other amenities also available to this level of HHonors. Now for some other knowledge - the Casitas are all privately owned and not a time share. They are very beautiful and we truly enjoyed our rooms. The only negative we would share is the housekeeping's kitchenware cleaning. We actually made it a point to do the dishes after see what the housekeepers version of cleaning was. In addition - our person would run our dishwasher each night which perplexed us since it was empty! Towels and Wash Cloths are a commodity here! Often when requested it would be 10-30 mins until received. Room Service comes from the main hotel so expect a wait and it may not be cold/hot due to distance. We bought a cooler thinking we could bring stuff to the pool and beach. Pool - no problem. Beach - not allowed. We didn't play any golf but the course looks fantastic. We actually took a drive out to the Trump golf course 3 towns over and in my opinion this golf course beat his regardless if they host the puerto rican idol. Since the weather was so horrible we never made it to old san juan or any other islands. An interesting famous fact is that the small island next to our private island is in today's release of the latest Pirates of the Carribean. While here we also saw them shooting final auditions for "puerto rican idol", a wedding magazine shoot and a golf magazine shoot. Casino - Don't expect Craps. 4 BJ tables, 1 Roulette, 1 Carribean Poker and 50 slot machines (80% for $.01). The BJ table also has unusual rules that i've never experienced from when the house is dealt vs winning rules. You'll understand what I mean when you get here. Don't expect Vegas or Atlantic City Rules! Everyone else captures the lovely resort, layout, etc... I wanted to capture in my narrative when I didn't see and I would want to know. In Closing - This is a 5 star resort if you stay at the casitas and plan appropriately. Enjoy your visit - and yes, We'll be back hoping for better weather!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: prisenchanting
Reviews.Content: We just returned from seven wonderful nights at Las Casitas Village! We reserved a one bedroom ocean view Casita for our family of four. The Casita was perfect! The ocean view was great and the furnishings were definitely newer and well chosen. The kitchen was new with stainless appliances, beautiful counter tops, the floors of the Casita were appealing terra cotta style tile. The room was perfectly clean-absolutely spotless upon arrival, and after each daily/nightly housekeeping it was just as beautifully serviced. We are planning return visits(already booked for 2012!), so I asked a butler to take me on a tour of other units. While our Casita was located in the south part of the village among the newer units, I was told that any units available to guests have been fully refurbished. The north end units I toured appeared just as wonderful as our unit. Our unit did not distinguish itself as different or better in any way from those that I toured-the units all looked like equally appointed wonderful accommodations. The vistas from the ocean view units I toured were all equally as stunning as our view. Las Casitas has wonderful people providing service-Lillien (Lilly) in the Manor House reception area is outstanding. She is professional, sincere, warm, kind and truly wants guests to have the vacation of a lifetime. Eddie (often in the main house and providing excellent Butler services) is also outstanding. Both are exceptional individuals with amazing knowledge of the island. Supervisors/Managers Sonia (in the Las Casitas dining area) and Yolanda (Manor House) were also especially wonderful, helpful and caring. All of the individuals that I mentioned provided us the opportunity to have that truly magical vacation as did many others! All were professional and outstandingly dedicated to the resort and its guests! The pools at Las Casitas are breathtakingly gorgeous! The infinity pool as well as the village pool are the most beautiful pool settings of any resort we have ever been to. The pools were never crowded and there were plenty of chairs, towels and shade. The golf cart transportation was perfectly timed for our family-we had an occasional very brief wait, but never did the wait concern us. The carts hold about 8 guests. Palomino Island was busiest on Saturday. Although we arrived on the third boat that Saturday, we were able to find great shade and there was never any problem with beach lounge chairs-there are more than enough even on a crowded Saturday. If you like more privacy-just walk away from the main area where the ferry docks -down the beach (around the corner and to the left) there were plenty of private, quieter spots. The snorkeling on Palomino Island is quite good and great for younger children too. TIP: Bring excellent water shoes as the sandy beach often changes to coral/rocky texture. The beauty of the island is that it also offers a very interesting beach with plenty of water activities-you can rent floats, snorkels, jet skis and kayaks. Everything was in perfect working order. The water park was fun for the kids, and I found the view from there to be among the very best at the resort. The park is built at the water's edge and you can relax on a lounge chair right near the water-without the sand! TIP: In the afternoon, the water park tickets were half price. The breakfast at Las Casitas was terrific-a beautiful setting with fine food and absolutely outstanding service. We did try a few of the other restaurants at the hotel-but only the casual ones. All service was outstanding-there were some food high points too. I was told by several guests that an Executive Chef has been hired to completely inspire the restaurants at the El Conquistador-we really look forward to some great changes! Lâ€™Estacion off the property was fabulous! There are also places all around to try-El Bahio was recommended by our BIO BAY electric boat tour, but we did not get to it. The BIO BAY electric boat tour is a wonderful way to go if you donâ€™t want to kayak with younger children (or just prefer a nice long time boating around the biobay). Passion offered authentic food in an indoor setting with white linens (but prices seemed reasonable). For a totally local experience, the inexpensive take out at Punto Carribe (on the corner of El Conquistador Avenue-look for the Churchâ€™s Chicken and next to it is Punto Carribe) was very good-locals I spoke with adore it and we were very impressed! TIP: If you are adventurous, try MINI BOAT ADVENTURES! The snorkeling was outstanding and driving the boats is a true adventure. As for the resort, there is so much to do, you can have any vacation you like-active or quiet. As for the Casitas, with a family of four, if your budget allows for it, the two bedroom casitas are probably the way to go, (We have two children of school age-they slept on air mattresses which they described as comfortable-it was a nice way to enjoy a great view/room in the high season-so it was a good option too). We have traveled elsewhere and to many exceptional, exclusive, high end resorts- I can sincerely say that this is by far the best vacation we have ever had. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, location, options, recreation ... but be prepared to pay”
Reviews.Author: PRFROMPHILA
Reviews.Content: Las Casitas at El Con is an incredible facility - we had a 3 BR villa, which was roomy (3 full BA), overlooked the ocean, had a full kitchen, and easily slept 7. There are (at least) 3 pools in Las Casitas (including an ocean view Infinity pool) - so a swim was always a hop/skip/jump away. There is butler service - which was ok; we didn't realize this until our 5th night so we werent able to take advantage of the service as much as if it had been advertised upfront. While Las Casitas is walkable to the main hotel, there are golf carts to take visitors to the main hotel - while convenient most of the time (make sure to call and order a golf cart before you head to the waiting spot), sometimes the wait was 5-10 min. The activities at the hotel are great - Palomino Island outstanding (albeit a 15 minute boat ride away), but they only had 1 boat to take/retrieve visitors - from Las Casitas, it takes approximately 30-40 min to get to the island (door to beach). The waterpark is small but the kids loved it (particularly the 200 foot vertical slide) - the good news for parents is that you can see the entire park from seats in the middle. There are also plenty of pools, night movies at the main hotel pool, several dining options, etc. For off-site activities - we did the El Junque rainforest (highly recommend - 45 minute ride from El Con), the light-house tour (decent - 5 minute ride, price is right $58 for family of 7), bio-luminescent bay kayak tour (expensive if you go through hotel - make sure to book offsite (you will see signs approaching the hotel); and you can walk to the site instead of taking a $15 cab rid (or 35 for family of 7)). Lots to do, but booking through hotel agency (GSI) is REALLY expensive. The rainforest was $500 for a family of 7 (had to pay for 8). We pre-ordered groceries to be delivered to our room - was a good option (they only charge an extra $25 for the first trip, $5 for each thereafter) but don't expect to get exactly what you want. The food options on-site are good but very expensive. If you need supplies, try the store at the bottom of the fanicular (on the way to the boat ride to Palominio) instead of the hotel store (which is ridiculously expensive but convenient). DO NOT TAKE THE HOTEL SHUTTLE TO EL CON - take a taxi; our van for 7 people was $85. Or rent a car, particularly if staying at Las Casitas - there are plenty of parking spaces right outside of the villas and you'll save lots on cab rides (we probably spent $1000 over the course of a week in cab rids to/from dinners, excursions, Old San Juan, etc). For off-site authentic Puerto Rican dinner - we highly recommend Passion - it is 5 min offsite. We've been there every year for the past 4 years and have never been disappointed. The kids look forward to it every year. Gotta have the seafood mofongo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: IronBird0
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days at Las Casitas and found it to be a very nice resort. I chose the Las Casitas over the El Conquistador due to the generous size of the rooms at Las Casitas. We were not disappointed, our room had 2 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, a full kitchen and a nice living room overlooking the ocean. The rooms were clean and well appointed and staff were very friendly. The only drawback to staying at Las Casitas versus El Conquistador is that from Las Casitas you will take a shuttle or golf cart ride from the hotel to the El Conquistador where all the activities are, such as the restaurants, casino (small casino - not many tables - just black jack, caribbean stud and roulette for tables and lots of slot machines). I would recomend Las Casitas for people wanting a lot of space and who don't mind taking a quick golf cart ride, or walking up to the El Conquistador. If you don't want to walk (its a hilly walk) or take the golf cart ride, then El Conquistador or Las Marinas may be a better fit for you. You will also need to take the ferry to Palomino Island from the base of the El Conquistador, down at the Las Marinas section of the resort, where it is a less than 10 minute catamaran ride to the island and beach. The island is pretty nice. Water is quite shallow and there is some decent snorkeling. There is an outdoor restaurant and also a beach side bar, so that's pretty convenient. We ate at the resort a few times and it was ok, I'd say it was fine as far as resort food goes. Nothing extravagant, but nothing to complain about, either. We went off the resort to La Estacion down the street and I'd definitely recomend going there once to allow a chance to try a local restaurant. Its in an old converted gas station - but don't worry, its actually done over in a really cool and fun manner. The food there was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the view!”
Reviews.Author: europetrip07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Las Casitas Village for several days in March of 2011 with my husband to relax. It was our first trip to Puerto Rico. The web site promised incredible views of the ocean, and they delivered. Our Casitas guest room had a large balcony with a table and lounger and terrific view of the ocean. Our room was clean and well kept. No seperate shower and tub which I would expect at this price otherwise no major complaints. Was a little disappointed in the lack of mini fridgen and the 14% resort fee was a little much. The room was quiet. The resort was wonderful. We loved the infinity pool and private beach. Not crowded the week we were there, but got very crowded the day we left. Spent some time at the tables in the small casino. The blackjack dealers had a couple of rules that created a little additional unfair advantage to the player. They did not deal themselves a second card until after everyone else played out their hand. So if they were showing an ace they could still deal themselves a blackjack after you had put more money on the table by splitting or doubling down on your hand. All-in-all, we play just for fun so wasn't a big deal. Food on the property was good but way overpriced, although we had breakfast included with our package. Some people complained about the boat ride to the island, but it was quite fun and I thought it was a neat feature. Had a great meal at L'estacion, although bring bug spray. I think I wound up with 10 mosquito bites from that meal. Also did the bio bay night tour and rainforest. Bio bay worth seeing for sure. Rent a car for the trip, it was well worth it. Would go back for sure, had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise ship on land”
Reviews.Author: FloridaDays
Reviews.Content: After spending three days at this "resort" I was wondering why Waldorf Astoria would even put their name on it. The grounds of the hotel are it's only redeeming characteristic. From the moment we walked into the room I was immediately disappointed. The room felt like a poorly designed and outdated timeshare. The furniture was cheaply made and our bedroom's interior door was broken and leaning against the wall. Apart from the terrible room the food was worse. If you wanted to eat anything you had to visit what I called "the cruise ship on land." This "cruise ship" was the main hotel that required a golf cart ride to get to. Once there it was overcrowded, noisy and stocked full of poorly prepared and bland tasting meals. In order to get anything worth eating we had to leave the compound ($60 round trip) and venture to local spots with much better food, and vastly cheaper in price. The last thing I would like to add is the difficulty involved in getting to the beach. The trip in its entirety takes 40 min and once there you are treated to a white sand beach with 2000 other hotel guests. The hotel has its own island and I swear they tried to fit every hotel guest on the island at the same time. I would recommended looking somewhere else on PR to stay or bypass PR altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Even better in 2011”
Reviews.Author: eatrite
Reviews.Content: When my extended family (grandparens, parents, young children) returned to Las Casitas this year (read my previous posting), we all noted within the first few days significant improvements. Our initial greeting and ease of check in was followed by efficient butler service. Our room with stocked on the first days with all the food and drinks requested. The concierge took care of all extras (e.g. roll away beds) needed. Food and bar service to the pool as well as poolside lunch was now timely. Housekeeping scheduled turndown service according to our request based upon the children's bedtime. The staff is friendly and the grounds are magnificient. The beach and the water park are a bonus. It doesn't get better! We are already planning next years trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as the price and web site would lead you to expect.”
Reviews.Author: 1smartmama
Reviews.Content: The "2-bedroom casita" we booked was actually 2 units separated by a small foyer. It felt strange to have our 2 children sleeping next door rather than in the same unit as us. We were told upon check-out that the South portion of Las Casitas Village has actual 2-bedroom casitas and is newer (7 years old) and nicer. We asked for a change of room after the 1st night and were told nothing was available with an ocean view - which we were not willing to give up. So the casita was very dated and not luxurious. A/C did not work properly so we were either freezing or sweating the entire time. Called it in but no one ever showed to fix/adjust the thermostats. The food at every restaurant we tried was okay (not superior) and ridiculously overpriced. We know fine dining and don't mind paying for it. This was not fine dining. All of the people who work at Las Casitas and El Conquistador were very pleasant. The place is so spread out that you have to walk quite a bit (up and down many staircases) to get from one area to another. The beach is a long walk, an elevator ride, a funicular ride (down the cliff), and a ferry ride away. Not very convenient at all. During our 1 week stay we went to the beach only once because it was a hassle. The pools are not heated and with the wind whipping around us at 20 or 30 mph all week it would have helped a great deal to have a heated pool.
