We arrived and everything was fine at check in, then they showed us to our casita ( 1 bedroom villa) with living and kitchen areas. As soon as we stepped in we could smell the strong odor of mold. Before letting the bell man leave I looked around, the bedroom area was decorated and stunk no better than a motel that you would pay $50 for a night! A second later as I was looking around I stepped right into a puddle of water and realized that there was a major leak on the walls of the bedroom and all across the ceiling and floors...it was disgusting. Not 5 star at all. So I called the front desk, and they did not believe me at first, so they first sent us a maid to "clean it up" (you cant just wipe up a major leak!) then when the maid said she couldnt do anything about it, I called the front desk again and they said "we'll send the engineer" , so we patiently waited and again the engineer said he cant do anything about a major leak. So about 2 hours later after all this chaos of them not just taking my word about the leak a lady at reception named Laura told us the only other casita available was very far all the way down the hill and was a 2 bedroom, newly renovated casita. Thank g-d she gave us that room because if not my husband and I were ready to leave and go to the Ritz in San Juan. The newly renovated casita was absolutely gorgeous with spectacular views and wrap-a-round terraces with lounge chairs and tables and so on. The bathrooms were nice but not great. Same thing with the beds, not too comfortable, but manageable. It was great having the new kitchen and large open living area, but had it not been for the leak in the old casitas we never would have got this room. Now that leaves me to wonder how the hotel is still renting out the old casitas with that are infested with mold and water and just felt damp and gross... The second terrible thing was the service, the place is just way too big, I guess, the service was awful, for example the morning that we left I called for some shampoo and conditioner at 9 o clock, half an hour goes, then an hour, and I finally call again, they just apologize, but if it was the only time, I would understand, but everything is in slow motion. At the pool and ocean they dont ask you if you want a drink you have to wave down the only waiter that is serving 100's or people, then when the drinks arrive 30 mins later they are no longer even frozen! I really dont understand because the more waiters, the more drinks served and bought which means more $ for the hotel... The service for the shuttle was ok but not great, we just called and told them to call our room when the shuttle was arriving. However when we needed a shuttle from the main hotel back to the casitas it took close to fifteen minutes.. We didnt eat any of the food at the hotel, but did order a fruit platter from room service, I thought Puerto Rican fruit was good, man was I wrong, the fruit had absolutely no taste as if it was not in season at all... All in all, the newly renovated casitas have great views and are roomy, but the service was definintely lacking, and I would not come here again nor recommend it. Especially, if they are still booking the guests in the old casitas. I am starting to wish we stayed somewhere else, even though our vacation is over.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be worse!”
Reviews.Author: nehaopper
Reviews.Content: After reading great reviews of this place, my boyfriend and I decided to try it in July 2007. Our initial impression of the place was quite good - the views are spectacular and there is quite a bit to do on the resort itself. However, the food at every single restaurant and cafe on the resort is overpriced and terrible. We dont mind paying a high price for a meal but atleast it should be edible. But we were not satisfied in the least bit with the food. The other horrible experience we had with this place was theft. We had money locked in the room safe, and upon returning to our room in the evening, the safe was open and all the money was gone. After logging a complaint with the resort police, the response was horrifying and lazy. Upon our return from Puerto Rico, we called them every week to get a status on the investigation but all in vain. Its October 2007 and no one has called still and when we call them, they say " the manager is not there." We are definitely never going back there - contrary to what we had decided when we first saw the resort.

Reviews.Title: “once a 5 diamond resort”
Reviews.Author: brandbridgeltd
Reviews.Content: Las Casitas is a beautiful resort in a stunning setting with a wonderful staff who truly understand "customer service". The resort is clean, well landscaped and quiet with three distinctively beautiful pools. The garden courtyards with babbling fountains provide a perfect peaceful touch, far from the hustle and bustle of the main resort at El Conquistador. Much of what had made Las Casitas Village a five diamond resort years ago remains, but what brings it down is the lack of customer service and attention to detail at the main resort, El Conquistador. We were totally surprised at the amount of trash--- piles of it---on the beaches at Palomino Island. The beach bar tenders were lazy and rude. When we called the manager's office at El Conquistador to complain about the trash, we were told he would return our call---he never did. The staff at Las Brisas Restaurant is horrible. Don't go there if you don't intend to order the breakfast buffet. They have no time for you if you order off the menu. The staff at Otello's; The Strip House; and Bella Vista are all wonderful, so it's isolated pockets of rude and poor service that no one should have to experience especially when paying for over priced drinks and food. Keep an eye on what you're paying for as a Mojito at Las Casitas costs $16 and $8 at the Bella Vista Bar at El Conquistador. Las Casitas bars and restaurants automatically add a 20% gratuity, but not at the El Conquistador restaurants and bars, so be careful to check. The new management seems to be improving some of the older sections of the resort, but they need to concentrate on a uniform guide of customer service for all of their staff. Hopefully they will bring back such attention to detail that made the entire experience, both at Las Casitas and El Conquistador, a five diamond resort---otherwise they need to drastically reduce their rates.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated Experiences”
Reviews.Author: DallasTexas_TGG
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five night stay in a one bedroom, garden view casita with my husband and daughter. Everything we experienced was positive. It was quiet, peaceful, clean, accomodating, family friendly (everyone seemed to have kids), easy, worth every penny. Anything negative that I read online beforehand or heard in person while we were there, was easily worked around. I along with nearly everyone we spoke to seemed to feel that the positivies more than outweighed the negatives. Here were a few things we worked around... The food is expensive!! For some reason when I read that, I thought we would be able to make better restaurant/menu selections and not spend $250 a night on dinner. On average you are going to be looking at $16 burgers, $44 steaks, $10 mixed drinks. As soon as we arrived we spoke to our butler about creating an order for groceries and I even took someone's advice from this site & added alcohol to the list. Others we met hopped in a taxi and went to Wal-Mart themselves. Las Casitas sends someone to the grocery store and charges you based on what you spend, so it ends up being $25 for every $100 you spend. We spent $150 for groceries, two bottles of alcohol and the surcharge & it kept us in stocked for breakfast & lunch the entire visit. The beach is rocky. For the most part it's actually broken coral from a reef that you can walk out to. We wore flip flops in the water, which wasn't ideal, but wasn't a problem either. None of the kids seemed phased and most of the adults seemed okay to consider it a non-issue. NO INTERNE or movies! They are accomodating and will let you use the internet in the Las Casitas office. Otherwise, you have to take your laptop to the main hote (El Conquistador) for wireless access. They said they are working on getting wireless to Las Casitas, so at the very least check in with them. Also, our living room had a DVD player, but there were no On Demand movies available. They said they don't have a subscription for anything other than the El Conquistador, so if keep that in mind if your like to curl up with an On Demand movie during your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Horrible! Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Soni007
Reviews.Content: This hotel claims to be a luxury hotel. However, I donâ€™ think they know the meaning of luxury. The rooms were disgusting and the service was terrible. We paid over $600 a night and got a smelly casita with a moldy bathroom and a leaky refrigerator. For that rate, I expected a lot more. If I ever go back to Puerto Rico, I would never stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service I Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: icssteffens
Reviews.Content: During my vacations at Las Casitas Village my daughter and two friend were returning from the private beach and took the monorail to the hotel. Having started their trip up,the cable from the car broke and fell down to the starting place. They were helped by some construction workers to get out of the car because the door was stuck. Next day ,I requested assistance to take my daughter and friend to the hospital for check up because they were having some back and neck pain. They told me to take them to the hospital and if I needed transportation they will pay for a taxi. I lost 2 days of my vacations and all I received from the hotel was a tray with some cheese and . No one ever called to see if whow they were doing.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Infinity Pool. Great Palomino Trip. Bring Mop”
Reviews.Author: jgsgroups
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a guest room. I was lucky to get the ocean view. It was awesome. I think it is the best placed I have stayed. They gave you slippers which made it nice. The infinity pool was awesome. Very relaxing even when there are lots of peoples the view is so breath taking that you forget about annoying people around you. Is great that you can enjoy the Conquistador Hotel facilities, restaurants and pools. There are also two other pools at las casitas village and a few more in the conquistador. The golf cart ride from las casitas to el conquistador is fun. Palomino was great. The food at palomino was good. Is something like chili's quality. You can snorkel .. not great snorkeling but very entertaining and safe. The beach has lots of algae so bring beach slippers. There are nice beach umbrellas at Palomino if you want to stay away from the sun. The trip to Palomino Island is 7 minutes. They don't allow outside beverages or food but you can always pack a few in your back pack if you want to save a few bucks. The beach at Palomino is not that great but just knowing that you are in a small island makes it very interesting and fun. There are beach sports like Kayak rental and I think you can Kayak to palominito island which is another cute small little island half a mile from palomino. Beach sports are not free. Had Sushi at Blossoms one night and it was New York grade sushi and not too expensive considering that you are at a hotel. The conquistador lobby is nice and big overlooking the ocean and the pools. Service was Ok . The rooms were not super clean but enough for me. Tiles are harder to clean I guess. The balcony was huge and nice. If you can get a room with ocean view go for it .. is gorgeous. All rooms seem to be close to the parking but there are always stairs that will make you think twice to ask for help. The personal butler never showed and never heard of such a thing. Had no problem getting towels anywhere at the hotel. People were very friendly. This was definitely a great stay. They only minor flaw was the room floor which was a little bit dirty especially after moving the beds they don't clean under the beds. If you want ice you have to call room service. Cannot just grab it yourself. I don't know if there was a charge for that but heard that they charge for every call you make. I had no problems with my bill. Everything was in place and payed nothing extra for parking. Maybe they forgot to charge that? or parking is free ? I paid everything with my credit card cause I was warned about overcharges if using the cards they give you. I guess you should never mention your room number. I got to the hotel at 3:30 but the room was not ready. Had to wait for 2 hours but you can start using the facilities. Used all coffee the first day but never got refills. But at least someone came to asked if we needed anything and they gave us more towels and two little tasty chocolates. I paid $267 per night and it was definetly worth it with all the ammenities included. No kitchen in the guest rooms. This room is great for two people and one child. I am not sure that paying $ 400 per night is worth it but at least you get 2+ bedrooms and a kitchen. El conquistador is a few bucks cheaper but I rather pay 50 to 100 bucks more per night at las casitas for the guest room. They don't give you toothbrush/tooth paste so bring your own. My Wife did a room service check. She marked the glasses of te bathrooms slightly + the disposable coasters and they were not changed after room service. Don't expect great service but if you want to enjoy a nice and very relaxing place with a cute little island which is free to visit in a big resort with a breath taking infinity pool Las Casitas village is one of the best in puerto rico maybe in the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “Will Certainly Return”
Reviews.Author: Bowhead
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue, but the urge struck me as I was planning my return visit to Las Casitas in February. We stayed there at the end of January 2007 and I feel somewhat guilty for not writing sooner. Where do I start...I have stayed at the El Con a number of times, however this was my first visit to the resort with my family, so I decided to book a stay at Las Casitas. My wife, three children(2,7,9) and I stayed in a 2 bedroom casita overlooking the ocean. Wow, what a view! Check-in was a breeze, and we were immediately greeted by our butler, Luis Posada. While I can't comment on the other butlers, I cannot say enough about Luis. He was always there (except for the day he was off), extremely attentive, very proffessional and courteous. He certainly made our stay much more enjoyable. The pools are great. The private Island is very relaxing. As for the food...True, it is expensive, but not outrageously expensive. We ate off campus a couple of times and it was great. Would highly reccomend trying that. As for the service...If you are looking for 5 star New York or Paris service, you won't get it here. However, keep in mind THIS IS THE CARRIBEAN...Relax. If you are looking for 5 star Carribean service, Las Casitas delivers. No matter what resort I am at, It is very rare that I can travel with 3 small children and truly feel relaxed, but Las Casitas pulled it off. For that, I am extremely thankful. I have been to many resorts over the years, with and without family, and I can now say with certainty that Las Casitas is the Jewel of the Caribbean. Overall, I would highly recommend Las Casitas.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: geekhead
Reviews.Content: - The view from just about anywhere is stunning - The food was great. (not any more pricey than any other resort) - The beach was awesome - The room was pretty good (guest room), the view was to die for. They do have newly renovated rooms. We didn't have one, and had no complaints. - Someone previously complained about the drinks .....not a problem there for us. - Stingrays was a great place to eat. - We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Las Casistas”
Reviews.Author: snoles
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place! The most beautiful resort I have been to. My only complaint was housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: kdenise
Reviews.Content: After seeing Las Casitas voted #1 in the T&L Family mag, we decided to book it for our family getaway during our daughter's Spring Break. We were really nervous because of the mixed reviews, but decided to go anyway. We found Las Casitas to be really lovely. The grounds were beautiful and our room was spacious and quaint. I mistakenly booked a guest room instead of the one bedroom villa, but we still were not disappointed. We also thought the cost of the room was very reasonable. The one thing that we totally agree on in the other reviews is that it is quite expensive. We first thought these were travelers who may not want to "pay" or perhaps weren't discriminating, but Las Casitas is expensive. You don't get a break on anything. Take others advice and do your own shopping for meals in on some days. We ate at several of the restaurants and our favorite was Strip Steakhouse. Service was great! Our steaks were flavorful and cooked to perfection. Seafood pasta amazing and fresh. Our server was even great with our 4 year old daughter who was out with us very late since it was our last night. Stingray Cafe was also really good. Best place for burgers- Virgin Burgers by one of the main pools. Palomino Island was a lot of fun. Great for entire family regardless of ages. Kids club seemed really good although we didn't use it. We definitely agree with those who said to rent a car. It gave us the flexibility to go off the property and explore on our own. It turned out to be cost effective, but also gave us the flexibility we needed with a 4-year old. We explored the El Yunque on our own and had a wonderful time. In addition, we hung out at Lucillo Beach and did the Bay Biolumenescent on our own. Overall it was a great trip. We would visit again with groceries. By the way, we aren't heavy drinkers, but we were disappointed iin the quality of cocktails. They tasted fantastic, but they all tasted like Virgin drinks! Add liquor to your grocery list!

Reviews.Title: “loved las casitas, but bring a fat wallet”
Reviews.Author: momofthreepa
Reviews.Content: Las Casitas is great. Definitely superior to El Conquistador, much quieter, more plush, secluded. The rooms and service are great. Don't believe any bad reviews. Everyone we spoke with thought it was great...... just VERY expensive on the property. No need to leave property with lots of choices in menus and activities. Palomino Island is great. Recommend the resort highly .

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort on the Island!”
Reviews.Author: llychornblower
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location removed from all of the San Juan chaos. Service, amenities and professionalism at it's finest! Fabulous Casitas, food, pool areas, marina, spa, golf and private beach. All housekeeping staff spoke better english than any American Hotel we've frequented. Well worth the price. A small tip goes a long way on this property!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: moreace01
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews, we decided to stay at Las Casitas over the El Conquistador - and am very glad we did! We were a bit nervous because of some bad reviews. We loved Las Casitas - the ocean view from our room was outstanding, the infinity pool was gorgeous (albeit a bit cold) and it was much quieter and prettier than El Conquistador. As others have noted, the food isn't great - we did enjoy the food at the Strip House and had cheap breakfast at David's Cookies. But did not enjoy the Stingray Cafe and definately would not recommend the cafe by the casino at the main hotel. We were a little disappointed that there was no good Puerto Rican food offered at the hotel. If we had more time, we would have rented a car to explore a bit more(the traffic isn't as crazy as people make it sound, but lots of roads aren't marked so I am sure that can make things confusing). The resort grounds are so big that you are kind of isolated there. But, between the pools and Palomino island, there was enough to do to keep us happy. We also did the bio-bay tour and really enjoyed that. All in all, we were very happy with our trip to Las Casitas and would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Las Casitas!!!”
Reviews.Author: arp1997
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at Las Casitas. After reading many of the reviews on this website, I didn't set my expectations very high. However, we were thrilled with our stay at the property!! The staff was very friendly and out going, and the property and room were beautifully maintained. We had booked a guestroom but were upgraded to a one bedroom villa with ocean views. For a $25 fee our butler did grocery and beverage shopping for us (much cheaper than a cab or renting a car). We had plans to venture off the resort, but we loved it so much we didn't budge. Palomino Island was beautiful, as was the infinity pool. We are early risers, so there were always plenty of sun chairs for us. The restaurants at the main hotel were good- notably the chinese and steak places. I do agree that the food and drinks were expensive- averaging $40-$50 for two for lunch and well over $100 for two at dinner. But hey, you're on vacation, right??? The facilities at the Golden Door Spa were excellent, including a well equipped fitness center. We also had one of the best massage treatments there as well. As we were leaving, we were already discussing our next visit to Las Casitas.

Reviews.Title: “Solid if expensive resort”
Reviews.Author: thirdavenue
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at Las Casitas in a new, ocean view one bedroom casita. We had a lovely time. Plusses are an amazing view, nice new big suite (bigger than our Manhattan two bedroom), amazing private beach/island, and Golden Door Spa is really, really nice. Minuses are that the food is average and terribly expensive (though the sushi is new york good and steak house is getting there) and the service across the resort is a little clueless (but not hostile), except services is great at spa and steak house. The butler thing is an unfulfilled promise, we met a butler on the first day, who was also our bell hop, but it appears in truth to be a pay service if you want any butlering, doesn't come included in the casita rate. Here's a solution to the expensive restaurants: rent a car and go off campus. Casitas charges a very high $65 per person to and from the airport. Instead of a couple paying that $260, rent a car for less than that and go out to dinner each night (and go to a nearby grocery and get some breakfast stuff). You'll save and there are some great-to-amazing restaurants in the area that the casitas staff can recommend for you. We were pretty concerned for our vaco considering the reviews we read here, but we set our expectations to average and were pleasantly surprised. That said, we cannot speak to older casitas or the El Conquistador hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL LAS CASITAS VILLAGE”
Reviews.Author: crispex
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Las Casitas Village was from November 20th to November 27th. The eight days were GLORIOUS!!! Las Casitas is located on one of the MOST beautiful properties in Puerto Rico. The views are great and the archtecture of the casitas always amaze me (this was our third visit) The casitas are large and well fitted. There is bedroom, livingroom, dining room and fully equipped kitchen. Bathroom is ample, with separate toilet area which is extremely useful and private when necessary. The INFINITY pool at Las Casitas forces you to truly relax and enjoy. The service at the pool area, concierge and throughout the casitas is great!!! You can tell I highly recommend Las Casitas. One minor voice of opinion: Bring back an on premise restaurant at Las Casitas for gourmet dining, as previously was.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the property! Service was so-so”
Reviews.Author: clatoo
Reviews.Content: The property was absolutely beautiful. The views from our little casita were breathtaking. Our room had a small kitchenette, a walk-in closet, a LARGE balcony and a really nice bathroom. The infinity pool had an amazing view. At night, there was a quiet hush that would drive you insane if peace isn't what you are looking for! The condos were well-kept, very clean. Decor seemed to be a bit outdated but no real big issue. Check-in was smooth save for the fact that they had no kings available (grown-ups should NEVER share a double for the price paid). The restaurants on the property left a WHOLE lot to be desired! There was not much of a selection and my husband & I considered just going to the Church's Fried chicken down the street. The hotel was so far from San Juan, that it felt like a chore trying to do anything exciting or touristy. The "butler" service that we were promised really wasn't all that it was cracked up to be. My husband called for a daquiri by the pool, it took 30 + minutes and cost $16!!!

Reviews.Title: “World-Class Resort in Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: Geanne
Reviews.Content: Las Casitas is an easy drive from San Juan and San Juan airport, located within the El Conquistador Resort. The gargantuan size of El Conquistador and the range and quality of facilities and activities are beyond impressive. We found our room and common areas, including the resort's many pools and hot tubs and restaurants, to be clean, well-maintained and well-managed. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite at Las Casitas and it was beautifully designed and decorated in a way that maximized the resort's dramatic location on a cliff overlooking the sea and outer islands. The outer islands include the resort's own private beach-island playground, Palomino. The boat ride to Palomino Island was delightful -- wonderful crew -- and we all greatly enjoyed swimming and snorkeling alongside the island's dock. We found the quality of the food at the resort to be fresh and high quality and the prices were reasonable, especially considering the overall quality of the resort. We also had a wonderful dinner at a local seafood restaurant off the resort property. We very much enjoyed both the resort's facilities and its location near small seaside communities. Hotel guests included families with children of all ages and couples from the U.S., Puerto Rico and many other countries. This is a resort that is suitable for families and for couples and other groupings and for business and for pleasure. Our conversation on the ride back to San Juan airport was dominated by questions about when we might return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: jms238
Reviews.Content: There may be no more impressive property out there than Las Casitas Village. Part of El Conquistador resort, Las Casitas is a little more upscale, with better service. We stayed there for our honeymoon and couldn't have asked for anything better. The view is beautiful, the pool is as good as advertised and the grounds are lush. There is not a better hotel setting out there. As for the shortcomings, the walls are a little thin in the rooms, but that's true at too many hotels. Also, the beach isn't exactly outside your door. You can get to Luquillo Beach about as fast as you can get to the resort's private island. For those who do not have deep pockets, the restaurants in the resort are very expensive (do NOT get trapped on Palomino Island with nothing to eat, because you will pay dearly), but nearby Fajardo has many restaurants and supermarkets to choose from. I have told everyone I know they should stay here, as the experience is unmatched. I was wowed every day of my stay. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Escape”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantastic week at Las Casitas. We stayed in one of the newer 3 bdrm casitas and it was incredible. Beautiful view. Quiet. Private. Granted, we're not used to staying in the Ritz or other luxury type resorts like some of those offering reviews....we're more like Hampton Inn/Embassy Suites kind of people. So for us, this was a dream vacation and a dream location. The pools were great. Palomino Island was great. A couple helpful notes perhaps: 1. Renting a car was helpful. You can do it at the resort but we did it from San Juan for the week. Much cheaper this way if you want to take tours on your own and not rely on all resort tours. For example, the Rainforest tour was approx. $50/person through the resort, but if you drove yourself, if was only $3/per person. Big Difference. We also saved the $60/person shuttle fee from the airport to the resort. We 'pricelined' a compact car for the week for about $180. 2. There's a grocery store about 5-7 minutes away. Stock up on breakfast foods, sodas, snacks, etc. The food is way overpriced...but that's resort food anywhere so you really shouldn't be shocked. 3. I'd highly recommend the Biolumenescient Bay tour. Very cool and unique experience. The same stuff that makes lightning bugs light up is found in these single cell plankton (1.6 million/gallon) and you can kayak out into a bay and swim and see your arms and feet glow as you swim around. Awesome. 4. If you want to snorkel, you can rent equipment on Palomino island for $8/person and snorkel on your own and see some very cool things versus the $60/person snorkeling tours. Granted, you may see more out on the tours, but if you're a novice and just want to experience it...go the cheap route. 5. My wife loved her spa experience and felt very pampered...much more so than any spa she's been to before. 6. You can walk to just about anywhere you want to get to in about 10 minutes or so. You can get shuttled anywhere you like as well, but we enjoyed the walks. 7. As for the 'fine dining' restaurants, we ate at Blossom's (chinese and japanese) and Isabella's (steak). Both were okay, but not great. I've had better steaks, but it wasn't bad and the chinese food we had was better than average. 8. One thing you can inquire about is a vacation planner. This person was wonderful and extremely helpful in booking all our reservations and tours. Hope that helps some. I'd highly recommend the experience and would jump at the opportunity to return.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Prices not worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I stayed at Las Casitas village in order to attend a wedding. The room was OK, but considering that we payed over $1000 per night, I would have expected much more. The beds were what I would expect to find at a Motel 6, the tub and sinks didn't drain, and the floor was tile with no rugs in the bedrooms. My feet got dirty as I walked barefoot across the floor. The refrigerator broke, flooding the kitchen. We had to wait over 2 hours for a repair person to arrive. The maid had not left us ANY towels that day, so we had no way to mop up the wet mess ourselves while we waited. My uncle got locked in the bathroom, due to a broken door. He finally had to muscle his way out, as help was not forthcoming. The laundry staff ruined two shirts which were to be worn for the wedding cerimony. My father-in-law had over $900 stolen from his in-room safe. The hotel management offered absolutely no apology or compensation for our troubles.The staff was rude and unhelpful. I asked a pool staff member to move an umbrella for me so my children would get shaded from the sun. The surly staffer hastily grabbed an umbrella from neighboring chairs and halfheartedly placed it so that about half our chairs were shaded. I was about to ask for a second umbrella, but the staffer had already marched away. The clay tennis courts were uneven and poorly maintained. I would not be upset by such treatment if I were staying at a two or three star resort - however, I do expect a certain level of service when I am paying over $1000 per night for a so-called 5 star resort. Las Casitas Villas is NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wanabe 5 Star Resort That Tries Very Hard Not To Please”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The El Conquistador Resort & Las Casitas Village and Golden Door Spa markets itself as the premier 5 Star destination in Puerto Rico but is actually a maximum two star â€œwanabeâ€� establishment at 5 star prices. It promises iced Caviar and Champagne and delivers Soggy Peanuts and warm Ripple. I am of course referring the Las Casitas Village part of the Resort that offers itself up as a rarified experience. I am an experienced traveler with friends on travel desks at two major publications who fell victim to a marketing trap, ignored the advice of my travel card advisor and booked directly on-line. Shame on me. Las Casitas says "expect to be pampered by your personal butler that tends to your every needâ€� instead expect a guy that speaks no English to show up at your door on the morning of your check out, hand you his professionally designed business card (I put mine in my scrapbook) and wait for a gratuity. This after 7 days at Las Casitas and at check out, Iâ€™ve finally met my personal butler, a celebrity moment in my life. The hotel describes luxurious suites and appointments and if youâ€™re lucky, you will get my suite and have a waterfall, right in your suite, but alas itâ€™s the AC that drips water from behind the bedroom wall and puddles under your bed. The hotel engineer, a really nice guy and a Boss, told me that you have to expect water leaking if you put the AC on, he suggested we use the ceiling fans, I told him it was very warm and humid and that I like AC. Also, standing 6â€™3â€� in a room with 8â€™ ceilings the fans actually hung pretty close to my head. OK so I slouched a lot, avoided the fans and went to the Golden Door Spa for comfort and escape from my Luxurious suite. The Golden Door Spa is OK but not worth the bucks, donâ€™t expect w new age experience as much as an 80â€™s left over. But the staff attentive but should lose the attitude; itâ€™s not the Ritz Carlton, now thatâ€™s a Spa. Oh, I donâ€™t want to leave out the high end fixtures and faux finishes in the Bathrooms. But alas, the fixtures were broken and the fuax finish was actually lines of solid rust on your bathroom walls (yes, I tried my best to clean them off). To be fair, we did get some of the renowned Las Casitas personal attention when we got locked out of our room on five different nights. Calling from my cell phone to the front desk and after an hour sitting outside on a curb, a bellman would arrive, always smiling, apologizing and explaining â€œthis happens all the timeâ€�. Letâ€™s not forget the sterling management at the El Conquistador Resort & Las Casitas Village and Golden Door Spa. It seems that everyone is a manager or boss or an executive at the Hotel, maybe thatâ€™s the problem, they need actual workers. Finally, watch you Credit Card at the El Conquistador Resort & Las Casitas Village and Golden Door Spa or you might find a charge on the credit card that you checked in with for $20,000 (yes, its true, it really happened to me). They explained that this was a legitimate charge for "possible charges" that you "might" make during your stay, but I was reassured by the Manger at the front desk, not too worry, management at the resort will gladly refund my money, soon and if I complain, and if they call you back, my credit card company is investigating. We got a lot of apologies at El Conquistador Resort & Las Casitas and Golden Door Spa where employees, bosses, management seem confused and distant but achieve amazing clarity when they aggressively look to your for a gratuity. A bright spot are the wonderful restaurants. my advice unless you wanabe be a wanabe, is to eat at the many good restaurants at El Conquistador Resort & Las casitas Village and Golden Door Spa, stay away from the very public â€œprivateâ€� beach on an island by the Marina and, now read carefully, sleep someplace else. I did not listen to my experts, I expect that no one thinks anything thatâ€™s looks this good could be this bad, but eureka, it is.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and food, way too expensive for what is offered.”
Reviews.Author: TMVW
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, BUT in no way should this be viewed as more than a 2/3 star resort. Rooms are nothing like as luxurious as advertised, the one we stayed in had only 1 lounge chair on the balcony (when we asked for another, we were told that we were restricted to 1?) no plug for the bath (despite requests it was never provided) furniture is tired and walls are very thin!! Concierge/butler service was a joke. For the price we paid we expected a lot more .... Room service requests had to be chased up on several occasions, it took us over 45 minutes to get some ice delivered on 2 occasions!!! Food was very expensive and poor quality at Las Casitas ( thank goodness for some good local restaurants outside the resort) and service in the restaurants was lacking in all respects, staff appeared untrained, demotivated, disinterested and even the management handled our concerns with borderline disinterest. Whilst there, sadly we frequently heard other customers complaining of the slow, poor service and poor food quality. If not for the location we would have checked out and found somewhere else after the first night...despite our complaints, it did not get any better for the rest of the stay. Reluctant to try the spa (one of the reasons we chose this particular resort) bearing in mind all the other bad service we experienced, for fear of further costly disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great weather and mingling with the locals”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just returned from staying at Las Casitas Village. We went over Easter weekend and stayed in a 3 bedroom ground level casitas. We were in the middle section by the Manor house which was very conveniently located by both the infinity pool and our local pool. We chose to not have an ocean view as we were not sure how safe it was for our young child over the bluff. (It is very safe in hindsight). We arrived Good Friday and the resort was very busy. Many PR families came to the resort for the weekend and as a resul t the pool and ferry was very busy. We visited Palamino Island and were underwhelmed. We also found the ferry process - a significant process and not worth the effort. We instead decided to take daily road trips in the morning and visit local beaches - Luquillo and Seven Seas. During the week it was very quiet at both the beaches and the pools. We met many local PR families and enjoyed learning about where they lived and what extended family members were in the U.S. Everyone we met were very nice. We went to Seven Seas Beach 3 times and it is right up the road from the resort. Our butlers Ricardo and Carlos were very attentive and helped us decide what places were worth the visit. For example, we wanted to go to Viques for the day but with a young child - they advised against it since it would take too long and not be interesting enough. We bought groceries from Amigos down the road and rented a car which gave us freedom to sight see independently. We went to the El Yunque Rainforest and hiked one of the trails with a waterfall. We went out to dinner and the food was fine. Service at Otello was extremely slow and chaotic. Blossom's Japanese was the best service and especially with kids. We ate in at the Villa the rest of the time and it was much easier. All the restaurants in the Village close early and are not open for dinner or drinks. This apparently is a change due to the new owners (Blackstone Company). We did not venture up to El Conquistador pools as they looked crowded and the pools in The Casitas Village were calmer and felt more isolated. We spent the second 1/2 of each day in the pools. If you are looking for service however, this is not the pool to come too. We enjoyed our trip overall including a trip to Old San Juan and taking the new route 66 which is much faster than taking route 3 all the way into the city. Weather was great. Everyday sunny and in the mid to high 80s. We would return to PR and Las Casitas Village.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know about all the negative reviews but I just came back from a great family vacation from casitas. The staff was very prompt, nice and willing to help at all times. I did take people's advice and dined outside the hotel and I would recommend the restaurant "pasion" about 5 minutes away from the hotel. But other than that great villas (we were upgraded to 3 bedroom casitas from a 1 bedroom which was very nice), great pool (the infinity pool is beautiful), the golf course although very challending is very fun to play at and the camino island was a lot of fun too. I strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Uggh...yuck, are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: milosita
Reviews.Content: Thank god we had eachother...my boyfriend, my friends being there to help distract me from being so at all the bad service, disgusting plastic overpriced food and unhelpful staff. Its a real shame, Puerto Rico is such a beautiful place. The hotel didnt project any of the true beauty,people,culture and foods. Trying to get off the property to venture the rest of Puerto Rico was the hardest task I ever endured. They charge insane amounts and always tell you there are no reservations. That was their plan, they didnt want you to leave, they wanted you to stay and spend $100 on breakfast $200 on lunch and $400 on dinner (for 2 people) and the food was Horrific! Oh and 20 drinks later I have a slight buzz, Whatever...

HotelInfo.Name: Las Casitas Village, A Waldorf Astoria Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 1000 Avenida Conquistador, Fajardo 00738, Puerto Rico
